DashboardFunction Documentation

Code

This section defines the code that is used to create the dashboard.

  1"""
  2This module provides a Lambda function that generates a table of AWS cost and usage data or a table of AWS System Manager (SSM) command invocation statuses based on user input. The function is triggered by an AWS CloudWatch dashboard widget.
  3
  4Functions:
  5    - generate_table_cost(data): Generates an HTML table with AWS cost and usage data.
  6    - generate_table_ssm(data): Generates an HTML table with SSM command statuses.
  7    - convert_filter(filter_input, start_time, end_time): Formats start and end times and adds input filter to a list.
  8    - get_command_statuses(start_time, end_time): Returns a dictionary of counts for each SSM command invocation status type.
  9    - get_cost_usage(start_time, end_time): Returns an HTML table of AWS cost and usage data grouped by service.
 10    - lambda_handler(event, context): Main Lambda function that determines which function to run based on user input and returns the result as an HTML table.
 11
 12"""
 13
 14import boto3
 15from datetime import datetime
 16import os
 17
 18session = boto3.Session()
 19cost_explorer = session.client("ce")
 20document_name = os.environ['SSM_DOCUMENT_NAME']
 21project = os.environ['PROJECT_NAME']
 22ssm_client = boto3.client("ssm")
 23
 24
 25def generate_table_ssm(data):
 26    """
 27    Generate an HTML table with SSM command statuses.
 28
 29    Args:
 30        data (dict): A dictionary containing SSM command statuses.
 31
 32    Returns:
 33        str: An HTML table with SSM command statuses.
 34
 35    Example:
 36        >>> data = {'Pending': 10, 'InProgress': 5, 'Success': 20, 'Cancelled': 0, 'Failed': 1, 'TimedOut': 0,
 37        ...         'DeliveryTimedOut': 0, 'ExecutionTimedOut': 0, 'Incomplete': 0, 'LimitExceeded': 0}
 38        >>> generate_table_ssm(data)
 39        '<table>...</table>'
 40    """
 41    html = """
 42    <style>
 43        table {
 44            font-family: arial, sans-serif;
 45            border-collapse: collapse;
 46            width: 100%;
 47        }
 48        td, th {
 49            border: 1px solid #dddddd;
 50            text-align: left;
 51            padding: 8px;
 52        }
 53        tr:nth-child(even) {
 54            background-color: #dddddd;
 55        }
 56        .error td {
 57            color: red;
 58        }
 59    </style>
 60    <table>
 61        <tr>
 62            <th>Status</th>
 63            <th>Count</th>
 64        </tr>
 65    """
 66    total = 0
 67    for status, count in data.items():
 68        total += count
 69        if status == "Failed" and count > 0:
 70            html += f"<tr class='error'><td>{status}</td><td>{count}</td></tr>"
 71        else:
 72            html += f"<tr><td>{status}</td><td>{count}</td></tr>"
 73    html += f"<tr><td><b>Total</b></td><td><b>{total}</b></td></tr>"
 74    html += "</table>"
 75    return html
 76
 77
 78def generate_table_cost(data):
 79    """
 80    Generate an HTML table with AWS cost usage.
 81
 82    Args:
 83        data (dict): A dictionary containing AWS cost usage.
 84
 85    Returns:
 86        str: An HTML table with AWS cost usage.
 87
 88    Example:
 89        >>> data = {'AWS Lambda': '0.0000001', 'Amazon RDS': '0.0000002', 'Amazon S3': '0.0000003'}
 90        >>> generate_table_cost(data)
 91        '<table>...</table>'
 92    """
 93    html = """
 94    <style>
 95        table {
 96            font-family: arial, sans-serif;
 97            border-collapse: collapse;
 98            width: 100%;
 99        }
100        td, th {
101            border: 1px solid #dddddd;
102            text-align: left;
103            padding: 8px;
104        }
105        tr:nth-child(even) {
106            background-color: #dddddd;
107        }
108    </style>
109    <table>
110        <tr>
111            <th>Service</th>
112            <th>Cost</th>
113        </tr>
114    """
115    total_cost = 0
116    for service, cost in data.items():
117        cost = float(cost)
118        total_cost += cost
119        html += f"<tr><td>{service}</td><td>${'{:,.7f}'.format(cost)}</td></tr>"
120    html += f"<tr><td><b>Total</b></td><td><b>${'{:,.7f}'.format(total_cost)}</b></td></tr>"
121    html += "</table>"
122    return html
123
124
125def convert_filter(filter_input, start_time, end_time):
126    """
127    Convert the input filter into a format that can be used with AWS Systems Manager ListCommands API.
128
129    Args:
130        filter_input (dict): A dictionary representing the filter to be converted.
131        start_time (int): The start time in milliseconds.
132        end_time (int): The end time in milliseconds.
133
134    Returns:
135        list: A list of dictionaries representing the converted filter.
136
137    """
138    result = []
139    # format the start and end time
140    start_time = datetime.utcfromtimestamp(
141        start_time/1000).strftime('%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ')
142    end_time = datetime.utcfromtimestamp(
143        end_time/1000).strftime('%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ')
144
145    # add the start and end time to the result list
146    result.append({"key": "InvokedAfter", "value": start_time})
147    result.append({"key": "InvokedBefore", "value": end_time})
148    result.append({"key": "DocumentName", "value": document_name})
149
150    # add the input filter to the result list
151    result.append(filter_input)
152
153    return result
154
155
156def get_command_statuses(start_time, end_time):
157    """
158    Get the number of AWS Systems Manager commands in each status during the specified time period.
159
160    Args:
161        start_time (int): The start time in milliseconds.
162        end_time (int): The end time in milliseconds.
163
164    Returns:
165        dict: A dictionary where the keys are command statuses and the values are the number of commands in that status.
166
167    """
168    filters = [
169        {"key": "Status", "value": "Pending"},
170        {"key": "Status", "value": "InProgress"},
171        {"key": "Status", "value": "Success"},
172        {"key": "Status", "value": "Cancelled"},
173        {"key": "Status", "value": "Failed"},
174        {"key": "Status", "value": "TimedOut"},
175        {"key": "Status", "value": "DeliveryTimedOut"},
176        {"key": "Status", "value": "ExecutionTimedOut"},
177        {"key": "Status", "value": "Incomplete"},
178        {"key": "Status", "value": "LimitExceeded"},
179    ]
180    result = {}
181    for filter in filters:
182        filterValue = convert_filter(filter, start_time, end_time)
183        params = {
184            'Filters': filterValue
185        }
186        next_token = None
187        while True:
188            if next_token:
189                params['NextToken'] = next_token
190            try:
191                response = ssm_client.list_commands(**params)
192            except Exception as e:
193                if str(e) == "An error occurred (ThrottlingException) when calling the ListCommands operation (reached max retries: 4): Rate exceeded":
194                    return "Try Again"
195                else:
196                    raise e
197
198            if "Commands" in response:
199                if filter['value'] in result:
200                    result[filter['value']] += len(response['Commands'])
201                else:
202                    result[filter['value']] = len(response['Commands'])
203            if 'NextToken' not in response:
204                break
205            next_token = response['NextToken']
206    return result
207
208
209def get_cost_usage(start_time, end_time):
210    """
211    Get the cost and usage breakdown by AWS service during the specified time period.
212
213    Args:
214        start_time (int): The start time in milliseconds.
215        end_time (int): The end time in milliseconds.
216
217    Returns:
218        str: A string representing an HTML table with the cost and usage breakdown by service.
219
220    """
221    start = datetime.utcfromtimestamp(start_time / 1000).strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
222    end = datetime.utcfromtimestamp(end_time / 1000).strftime('%Y-%m-%d')
223    if start >= end:
224        return '<html><body>Please adjust the start and end dates to be greater than 1 day apart</body></html>'
225
226    # Create a session
227    session = boto3.Session()
228
229    # Connect to Cost Explorer
230    cost_explorer = session.client("ce")
231
232    try:
233        # Get the cost and usage breakdown by service
234        result = cost_explorer.get_cost_and_usage(
235            TimePeriod={
236                "Start": start,
237                "End": end
238            },
239            Granularity="MONTHLY",
240            Metrics=["BlendedCost"],
241            GroupBy=[
242                {
243                    "Type": "DIMENSION",
244                    "Key": "SERVICE"
245                }
246            ],
247            Filter={
248                "Tags": {
249                    "Key": "Project",
250                    "Values": [
251                        project
252                    ]
253                }
254            }
255        )
256    except Exception as e:
257        if "Start date (and hour) should be before end date (and hour)" in str(e):
258            return '<html><body>Please adjust the start and end dates to be greater than 1 day apart</body></html>'
259        raise e
260
261    # Extract the cost and usage data
262    data = []
263    for time_period in result["ResultsByTime"]:
264        data.extend(time_period["Groups"])
265
266    # Prepare the data for the table
267    cost_and_usage = {}
268    for item in data:
269        cost_and_usage[item["Keys"][0]
270                       ] = item["Metrics"]["BlendedCost"]["Amount"]
271
272    # Generate the table
273    table = generate_table_cost(cost_and_usage)
274
275    # Return the table
276    return table
277
278
279def lambda_handler(event, context):
280    """
281    AWS Lambda function handler.
282
283    Args:
284        event (dict): A dictionary representing the event that triggered the Lambda function.
285        context (object): An object representing the runtime context of the Lambda function.
286
287    Returns:
288        str: A string representing an HTML table with the cost and usage breakdown by service, or the number of AWS Systems Manager commands in each status during the specified time period.
289
290    """
291    start_time = event['widgetContext']['timeRange']['start']
292    end_time = event['widgetContext']['timeRange']['end']
293    query = event['widgetContext']['params']['name']
294    if query == "getCostandUsage":
295        html = get_cost_usage(start_time, end_time)
296    elif query == "getInvocationStatus":
297        command_statuses = get_command_statuses(start_time, end_time)
298        if command_statuses == "Try Again":
299            html = "<html><body><p><b>Something went wrong: Please try again by using the refresh button.</b></p></body></html>"
300        else:
301            html = generate_table_ssm(command_statuses)
302    else:
303        html = "No data"
304    return f'{html}'
